column1: There once lived an emperor whose name was Trojan. This emperor had goat's ears
column2: and he used to call in barber after barber to shave him. But whoever went in never came out again; for while the barber was shaving him
column3: the emperor would ask what he observed uncommon in him
column4: and when the barber would answer that he observed his goat's ears
column5: the Emperor would immediately be mad at him.At last it came to the turn of a certain barber to go who feigned illness
column6: and sent his apprentice instead. When the apprentice appeared before the emperor he was asked why his master did not come
column8: "Because he is ill." Then the emperor sat down
column9: and allowed the youth to shave him.As he shaved him the apprentice noticed the emperor's goat's ears
column10: but when Trojan asked him what he had observed
column12: "I have observed nothing."Then the emperor gave him twelve ducats
column14: "From this time forth you shall always come and shave me."
